blog.description:
Who am I? Can anyone really answer that question? I don't know who I am. I'm undefined.

What am I into? My biggest, but by no means only, passion is HP fanfics. My interests are many and varied, and my posts reflect my diversity.

Will our interests correspond? Only you can answer that question. Or will you, like myself, remain undefined?

summary: What do you think of this AU, Harry is suspicious of Draco during six year so he polyjuice himself into Blaise ((he...
question: What do you think of this AU, Harry is suspicious of Draco during six year so he polyjuice himself into Blaise ((he incapacitated Blaise and has him unconscious somewhere)) and tries to get close, not realizing the two were in a sexual relationship. during the school year Harry falls In love with Draco and when he finds out Draco's Mission his identity is revealed and their is drama between the two males. At the end Draco stays with Harry on the hocrux journey, forgives and marries him.
answer: I think this AU sounds great, I won’t lie but a love triangle here and there is not bad to read and I want to read it. The rest of the plot also sounds fucking intense and I’m ready to cry when a fic like this is ever written.

blog.name: askdaddydraco
blog.title: Ask Daddy Draco
blog.description:
Ask Box: OPEN

| Proud single father of 3 children named James, Aster, and Corvus |

My daughter’s blog: @the-star-child-universe |

body:
Teddy visits Draco

Draco was in his 25th week of pregnancy and there was no hiding that now. He was swollen around his face and stomach. His once leans stomach now was starting I star back at him when he looked down. He could feel the baby move more.


At six months pregnant, the male was actually very energized. He did cleaning around the manor (despite his mother and Bilby the House Elf objecting to it constantly) and he was doing his fair share of spending time with the kids. James especially needed his attention after the “cutting” episode. The boy was on anti-depressant potions, which kinda helped in that James was not a moody brat anymore. Draco wouldn’t say he was “back to normal” but he was definitely doing better then before.


Aster was still attending lessons for dancing and still ice skating like normal. Though she’s lonely without her friends. She constantly messages them with that magic phone or whatever and she’s been doing a lot more singing to herself (thank for noise-cancelling spells).


Just as Draco was cleaning the living room for the third time that day, he heard the alarm going off on the Wards. Draco looked out the window and saw two people he hadn’t seen for a while, but he could he be sure it was them? Draco was getting paranoid and why shouldn’t he? If Aster’s birth was anything, it was to keep this pregnancy secret.


Draco went to the door and hand his wand out. “Teddy?” Draco asked as he saw the young man with his fiancée and their new child, Maria. Teddy didn’t seem to happy at the moment but he put a smile on for his cousin who he called “Uncle Draco.”


“Hello Uncle Draco,” Teddy said. “Do you mind if we come in,” he asked.


“Sure, come on in,” he said and allowed the family to come inside. Draco raised his wand and with a wave, he turned off the alarm and reset it.


“Why do you have ward around your home?” Teddy asked and his eyes widen as he noticed the stomach Draco was sporting. Draco was silent and he said, “sit down on the dining room. We have a lot to discuss it seems,” he said.


Just at the moment, James came running down and he saw Teddy and his new budding family. “Teddy!” James jumped for joy as he hugged his god-brother. Teddy smiled and hugged back, “Hey little man, you’re in a good mood,” he smiled. James nodded and saw Maria, the small four year old smiling and waving at James. “Aww! Who wants to play with me?” He asked in a baby voice as Victoire put the girl down. “Just be careful with her James.”


“I will,” James said and knelt down, “wanna play unicorny?” He asked and started to neigh like a horse and trotted upstairs to play with the four year old.


Draco was actually more surprised by James being nice to the child rather then annoyed. He shrugged at the moment and sat down with the time.


“Uncle Draco, I believe you may have heard this already, but Harry has been arrested,” he said in a solemn tone, his hair shifting to the color black.


Draco nodded, “never thought I’d see the day.”


“Do you know why?” Teddy asked.


“Apparently he had been using illegal potions and neglecting children,” Draco answered with honesty.


“Yeah and it has to be a lie because Harry would never hurt children!”


Draco kept kid mouth shut but he asked, “did you come over to tell me this?”


“Well yes, and one other thing,” he said. “Since Harry can’t be at my wedding, o was wondering if you could take his place as a representative of my family,” Teddy asked. Draco was shocked by the request. While he certainly had helped raise Teddy after his grandmother’s (and Draco’s Aunt) death, it was not to the extend of offering him a place at Teddy’s family table at his wedding. Even if they had, he would still have to decline.


“I’m sorry Teddy. I can’t,” Draco spoke with remorse. “I can’t just let anyone see me like this and I would only distract from your big day,” he said. Teddy shook his head, trying to negate his assumptions, but Draco had to be firm. “Edward,” He said, using his first name. Draco looked at the younger man before him and hugged him dearly, “Family first. Always,” he said and pulled away slowly.


Teddy nodded, seemingly understand, “the invitation is always open if you decided to risk it,” Teddy said and stood up. He looked to his beloved and she also stood up, “so long Mr. Malfoy. And congratulations on your pregnancy,” she said. “We best fetch Maria,” She said as she headed upstairs to get her.


Teddy looked to Draco, and the two embraced another time, “Harry is proud of you Teddy. I’m sure that’s why he’s leaving you everything,” he said with some pain. That made Teddy let and and pull away, “I don’t know what you’re talking about. I wasn’t given anything, especially not money.”


“But he rewrote his will. I assumed it was for you,” he said. Teddy shook his head, “nothing. That money was all given to his new wife or something.”


That threw Draco for a loop, “WHAT NEW WIFE?!”

Just as Draco was cleaning the living room for the third time that day, he heard the alarm going off on the Wards. Draco looked out the window and saw two people he hadn’t seen for a while, but he could he be sure it was them? Draco was getting paranoid and why shouldn’t he? If Aster’s birth was anything, it was to keep this pregnancy secret.


Draco went to the door and hand his wand out. “Teddy?” Draco asked as he saw the young man with his fiancée and their new child, Maria. Teddy didn’t seem to happy at the moment but he put a smile on for his cousin who he called “Uncle Draco.”


“Hello Uncle Draco,” Teddy said. “Do you mind if we come in,” he asked.


“Sure, come on in,” he said and allowed the family to come inside. Draco raised his wand and with a wave, he turned off the alarm and reset it.


“Why do you have ward around your home?” Teddy asked and his eyes widen as he noticed the stomach Draco was sporting. Draco was silent and he said, “sit down on the dining room. We have a lot to discuss it seems,” he said.


Just at the moment, James came running down and he saw Teddy and his new budding family. “Teddy!” James jumped for joy as he hugged his god-brother. Teddy smiled and hugged back, “Hey little man, you’re in a good mood,” he smiled. James nodded and saw Maria, the small four year old smiling and waving at James. “Aww! Who wants to play with me?” He asked in a baby voice as Victoire put the girl down. “Just be careful with her James.”


“I will,” James said and knelt down, “wanna play unicorny?” He asked and started to neigh like a horse and trotted upstairs to play with the four year old.


Draco was actually more surprised by James being nice to the child rather then annoyed. He shrugged at the moment and sat down with the time.


“Uncle Draco, I believe you may have heard this already, but Harry has been arrested,” he said in a solemn tone, his hair shifting to the color black.


Draco nodded, “never thought I’d see the day.”


“Do you know why?” Teddy asked.


“Apparently he had been using illegal potions and neglecting children,” Draco answered with honesty.


“Yeah and it has to be a lie because Harry would never hurt children!”


Draco kept kid mouth shut but he asked, “did you come over to tell me this?”


“Well yes, and one other thing,” he said. “Since Harry can’t be at my wedding, o was wondering if you could take his place as a representative of my family,” Teddy asked. Draco was shocked by the request. While he certainly had helped raise Teddy after his grandmother’s (and Draco’s Aunt) death, it was not to the extend of offering him a place at Teddy’s family table at his wedding. Even if they had, he would still have to decline.


“I’m sorry Teddy. I can’t,” Draco spoke with remorse. “I can’t just let anyone see me like this and I would only distract from your big day,” he said. Teddy shook his head, trying to negate his assumptions, but Draco had to be firm. “Edward,” He said, using his first name. Draco looked at the younger man before him and hugged him dearly, “Family first. Always,” he said and pulled away slowly.


Teddy nodded, seemingly understand, “the invitation is always open if you decided to risk it,” Teddy said and stood up. He looked to his beloved and she also stood up, “so long Mr. Malfoy. And congratulations on your pregnancy,” she said. “We best fetch Maria,” She said as she headed upstairs to get her.


Teddy looked to Draco, and the two embraced another time, “Harry is proud of you Teddy. I’m sure that’s why he’s leaving you everything,” he said with some pain. That made Teddy let and and pull away, “I don’t know what you’re talking about. I wasn’t given anything, especially not money.”


“But he rewrote his will. I assumed it was for you,” he said. Teddy shook his head, “nothing. That money was all given to his new wife or something.”


That threw Draco for a loop, “WHAT NEW WIFE?!”

title: darken
description:
by HollyJinx

Harry ran.

He didn’t look back, arms pumping, fear fueling his legs faster than he’d ever gone. His heart pounded painfully against his ribs, each breath expelled loudly from his frantically working lungs. He could hear blood-curdling screams behind him, and terror forced him forward. The voice still circled inside his head as it chanted his name; it was faster now, stronger.

Panic, panic, panic.

summary: Hiya! Could I ask for Rowan headcanons?
question: Hiya! Could I ask for Rowan headcanons?
answer:
Admin: im love u nus

Rowan Khanna Headcanons:

  • Not sure whether you wanted romantic or general so for the sake of simplicity I’m going with both- this child is awkward at first. Come on, we’ve seen them, they’ve spent most of their time studying, romance isn’t something they’re used to.
  • With that said, they are a blushing stuttering mess whenever they’re shown affection, please save them. As the relationship progresses, however, they become more comfortable and even begin to look forward to it.
  • Study dates on cold days under a blanket with a warm fire and hot chocolate??? Yes please they love it, it’s maximum comfort AND educational!!!
  • Most definitely the type to go off spouting random facts, we’ve seen this, but it’s so endearing and they get so excited you just can’t help but let them continue. You now know a lot of dumb trivia thanks to this, but that just makes the relationship more fun!

title: Eternal Glory - The Chosen (1)
body:
This is also posted on my Quotev, as are my other stories.

If you asked a Hogwarts student their thought of who would be chosen to enter the Triwizard Tournament, they would most likely say Cedric or Cordelia Diggory. When prodded for more information, the student would boast of the twins.

For example, they might mention the twins were Prefects and on the Hufflepuff Quidditch team as Captain and Co-Captain. Cedric was the Seeker while Cordelia was the Keeper. Both were in their sixth year and had significant others. This would be where the student would get quiet as they revealed Cedric was dating a fifth year Ravenclaw named Cho Chang while Cordelia was in a relationship with a fourth year Gryffindor by the name of Seamus Finnigan.

Cedric didn’t mind his sister dating a younger guy so long as the guy treated her right and Cordelia had the same mindset when it came to her brother. The two had a bond similar to Fred and George’s, only it was stronger on Cedric’s end because Cordelia was 12 minutes his junior. When the Tournament was announced on September 1st, both Cedric and Cordelia counted down the 19 days until their 17th birthday.

At 5:31 P.M. on September 20, 1994, Cedric Diggory put his name into the Goblet of Fire. Twelve minutes later, at 5:43 P.M., Cordelia put forth her name as well.

~ Eternal Glory ~

Seamus and Cordelia spent Halloween morning at Hogsmeade hoping to pass time quicker there than at the castle. Though it was gray most of the day, the duo had a blast walking around the shops. They stopped and bought some candy from Honeydukes before going and getting some Butterbeer from the Three Broomsticks.

Afterwards they walked around the small village sharing laughs and stolen kisses, falling even deeper in love for the first time. Though neither would ever say it out loud, both Cordelia and Seamus were afraid of what they felt for the other as they hadn’t felt anything like it before.

On the carriage back to the castle, Seamus was rattling off something about a letter he got from his mum. Cordelia had to smile at the young Irishman as his cheeks flushed in slight frustration and her mind wandered off to their first meeting two years ago. It wasn’t anything special, really. Cordelia didn’t know then that the second year Gryffindor would find a way to plant himself into her heart only months later, and neither did he.

15-year-old Seamus stopped talking once he realized his dear Cora had stopped listening and smiled to himself. She didn’t do it too often, but Seamus figured she must be thinking of the Choosing Ceremony that was going to happen that night and he too let his mind wander. His friends had been impressed by his girlfriend’s actions and for a little while so was Seamus. At least until he realized that the Triwizard Tournament could be dangerous, then he became concerned.

The couple got off the carriage and entwined their hands together as they walked towards the Great Hall. Stopping just outside the door, Seamus stopped and kissed his Cora gently before wishing her good luck. The two then entered the hall and made their way to their respective tables.

Cordelia made small talk with her friends and housemates while the final few stragglers entered as well. Then Dumbledore silenced everyone in the hall before urging the Goblet of Fire to reveal the three champions.

The twins had joined hands and silently wished each other good luck. They would both be happy if either of them was chosen and support the other 100%.

The first champion to be selected came from Durmstrang. His name was Viktor Krum.

The second champion was from Beauxbatons; Fleur Delacour.

Finally, the Hogwarts Champion was to be announced. Cedric and Cordelia’s hands tightened around each other as they prayed that one of them would make it.

“The Hogwarts Champion is…” Dumbledore started as the Goblet’s fire flashed red before shooting out a singed piece of parchment. The headmaster grabbed it from the air and looked at the name. “Cordelia Diggory!”

“Yes!” The teen girl cheered to herself as her housemates all cheered and applauded. Cedric crushed his sister in a hug, saying “great job” before allowing her to go. Cordelia turned and grinned at the Gryffindor table where Seamus and his friends – including the Golden Trio – were all hooting and hollering.

Cordelia walked up to her headmaster to shake his hand before going to meet the other two champions and find out further instructions.

The three of them introduced themselves and made small talk, though it was slightly difficult, especially since English wasn’t either Fleur or Viktor’s first language, but it was all right for them. Or it was and would’ve been had Harry Potter not wandered in and announced that he was a champion as well.

The only response Cordelia could manage was a sigh and putting her head down in slight disappointment. Harry Potter as a champion would overshadow her, Fleur, and Viktor combined. Cordelia briefly wondered if Seamus knew what Harry had planned, but shook it off upon seeing Harry’s face.

It seems the boy who lived has found himself in another sticky situation.

The teachers that came rushing in after Harry only made Cordelia’s smile reappear. She couldn’t wait to see what this tournament had in store for them.

Finally, the Hogwarts Champion was to be announced. Cedric and Cordelia’s hands tightened around each other as they prayed that one of them would make it.

“The Hogwarts Champion is…” Dumbledore started as the Goblet’s fire flashed red before shooting out a singed piece of parchment. The headmaster grabbed it from the air and looked at the name. “Cordelia Diggory!”

“Yes!” The teen girl cheered to herself as her housemates all cheered and applauded. Cedric crushed his sister in a hug, saying “great job” before allowing her to go. Cordelia turned and grinned at the Gryffindor table where Seamus and his friends – including the Golden Trio – were all hooting and hollering.

Cordelia walked up to her headmaster to shake his hand before going to meet the other two champions and find out further instructions.

The three of them introduced themselves and made small talk, though it was slightly difficult, especially since English wasn’t either Fleur or Viktor’s first language, but it was all right for them. Or it was and would’ve been had Harry Potter not wandered in and announced that he was a champion as well.

The only response Cordelia could manage was a sigh and putting her head down in slight disappointment. Harry Potter as a champion would overshadow her, Fleur, and Viktor combined. Cordelia briefly wondered if Seamus knew what Harry had planned, but shook it off upon seeing Harry’s face.

It seems the boy who lived has found himself in another sticky situation.

The teachers that came rushing in after Harry only made Cordelia’s smile reappear. She couldn’t wait to see what this tournament had in store for them.

This is also posted on my Quotev, as are my other stories.

If you asked a Hogwarts student their thought of who would be chosen to enter the Triwizard Tournament, they would most likely say Cedric or Cordelia Diggory. When prodded for more information, the student would boast of the twins.

For example, they might mention the twins were Prefects and on the Hufflepuff Quidditch team as Captain and Co-Captain. Cedric was the Seeker while Cordelia was the Keeper. Both were in their sixth year and had significant others. This would be where the student would get quiet as they revealed Cedric was dating a fifth year Ravenclaw named Cho Chang while Cordelia was in a relationship with a fourth year Gryffindor by the name of Seamus Finnigan.

Cedric didn’t mind his sister dating a younger guy so long as the guy treated her right and Cordelia had the same mindset when it came to her brother. The two had a bond similar to Fred and George’s, only it was stronger on Cedric’s end because Cordelia was 12 minutes his junior. When the Tournament was announced on September 1st, both Cedric and Cordelia counted down the 19 days until their 17th birthday.

At 5:31 P.M. on September 20, 1994, Cedric Diggory put his name into the Goblet of Fire. Twelve minutes later, at 5:43 P.M., Cordelia put forth her name as well.

~ Eternal Glory ~

Seamus and Cordelia spent Halloween morning at Hogsmeade hoping to pass time quicker there than at the castle. Though it was gray most of the day, the duo had a blast walking around the shops. They stopped and bought some candy from Honeydukes before going and getting some Butterbeer from the Three Broomsticks.

Afterwards they walked around the small village sharing laughs and stolen kisses, falling even deeper in love for the first time. Though neither would ever say it out loud, both Cordelia and Seamus were afraid of what they felt for the other as they hadn’t felt anything like it before.

On the carriage back to the castle, Seamus was rattling off something about a letter he got from his mum. Cordelia had to smile at the young Irishman as his cheeks flushed in slight frustration and her mind wandered off to their first meeting two years ago. It wasn’t anything special, really. Cordelia didn’t know then that the second year Gryffindor would find a way to plant himself into her heart only months later, and neither did he.

15-year-old Seamus stopped talking once he realized his dear Cora had stopped listening and smiled to himself. She didn’t do it too often, but Seamus figured she must be thinking of the Choosing Ceremony that was going to happen that night and he too let his mind wander. His friends had been impressed by his girlfriend’s actions and for a little while so was Seamus. At least until he realized that the Triwizard Tournament could be dangerous, then he became concerned.

The couple got off the carriage and entwined their hands together as they walked towards the Great Hall. Stopping just outside the door, Seamus stopped and kissed his Cora gently before wishing her good luck. The two then entered the hall and made their way to their respective tables.

Cordelia made small talk with her friends and housemates while the final few stragglers entered as well. Then Dumbledore silenced everyone in the hall before urging the Goblet of Fire to reveal the three champions.

The twins had joined hands and silently wished each other good luck. They would both be happy if either of them was chosen and support the other 100%.

The first champion to be selected came from Durmstrang. His name was Viktor Krum.

The second champion was from Beauxbatons; Fleur Delacour.

Finally, the Hogwarts Champion was to be announced. Cedric and Cordelia’s hands tightened around each other as they prayed that one of them would make it.

“The Hogwarts Champion is…” Dumbledore started as the Goblet’s fire flashed red before shooting out a singed piece of parchment. The headmaster grabbed it from the air and looked at the name. “Cordelia Diggory!”

“Yes!” The teen girl cheered to herself as her housemates all cheered and applauded. Cedric crushed his sister in a hug, saying “great job” before allowing her to go. Cordelia turned and grinned at the Gryffindor table where Seamus and his friends – including the Golden Trio – were all hooting and hollering.

Cordelia walked up to her headmaster to shake his hand before going to meet the other two champions and find out further instructions.

The three of them introduced themselves and made small talk, though it was slightly difficult, especially since English wasn’t either Fleur or Viktor’s first language, but it was all right for them. Or it was and would’ve been had Harry Potter not wandered in and announced that he was a champion as well.

The only response Cordelia could manage was a sigh and putting her head down in slight disappointment. Harry Potter as a champion would overshadow her, Fleur, and Viktor combined. Cordelia briefly wondered if Seamus knew what Harry had planned, but shook it off upon seeing Harry’s face.

It seems the boy who lived has found himself in another sticky situation.

The teachers that came rushing in after Harry only made Cordelia’s smile reappear. She couldn’t wait to see what this tournament had in store for them.

Warnings: smut, public sex/exhibitionism, language

It was hard enough to do this alone, yet alone when someone was right next to you.

 Teddy had a bad habit of clicking his pen that he’d got from a muggle friend. He’d do it over and over until it was steady like the ticking of a clock. His thumb would press down the button once, twice, three times. Every time it sprung up, he’d push it back down. It was a way for him to hone his focus but a way for you to lose yours.
 You’d already managed to ignore it for half an hour, surely you could ignore it for a couple of minutes more.
 You were studying lethifolds for your seventh year defence test that was approaching a lot faster than you’d like it to. You’d made it through half of the chapter and wrote two rolls of parchment and yet it’s now that you’re stumped. You’ve read the same sentence over and over and over and yet nothing seemed to register inside of your head. It was as if the words had lost all meaning, no matter how much you forced yourself to concentrate on each word nothing was making sense, the letters started to look jumbled and out of order - you couldn’t tell if what you’d just written was spelt right or not because the whole word looked weird. It was that damn clicking.

Finding the sentence you were on before was enough of a challenge - but then it started again. You slammed your book down on the library desk, sighing and glaring with all your might at Teddy. 'What?!’
'The pen!’
'Right, sorry.’

He waited until you had relaxed and focused again before he pressed the edge of the button down against the wooden table. The noise was even more annoying than when he just clicked it normally. If looks could kill that livid glare would end his life a lot earlier than he expected.
‘Teddy! Stop clicking that damn thing!’
‘Make me.’

He shook his head when you glared at him and rather he stripped himself of his tie and motioned for you to bite down on the material.  You stayed like that for a while, brushing your fingers through his scalp and pulling the tie from your mouth. You laughed when you put it back around his neck, there was no way he was getting away with not getting asked questions about that.
 He looked up at you, smiling dopily and landing a kiss on your lips. He waited until you had moved off of him to clean himself up as best he could, which lead to his next question.
‘What are you going to do about-‘ He watched as you slid your panties back on. His eyes widened, staring at your legs and the wet mark that was growing bigger. ‘My dorm. Ten minutes.’
